EmailTemplate.subject: Thank you for your interest in ASU's Master of Science in Clinical Exercise Physiology
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
{!Contact.FirstName},
Thank you for your interest in the new Master of Science in Clinical Exercise Physiology (MS CEP) program. I invite you to review some of our web pages as you explore this exciting, new degree. I am listing them below for your convenience.
This page offers general information about the program: https://webapp4.asu.edu/programs/t5/majorinfo/ASU00/NHCEPMS/graduate/false
The priority application deadline is March 15. Applications will continue to be reviewed as long as space is available. GRE scores are required. Typically students will take 2 years (4 semesters) to complete the program. You can estimate the cost of your attendance, based on current tuition/fees: https://students.asu.edu/tuitionandfees
Upon completion of the program and the required hours of clinical experience, you will be eligible to sit for the American College of Sports Medicine (ACSM) Registered Clinical Exercise Physiologist (RCEP) certification exam. You can find out more about this exam at the ACSM website: http://certification.acsm.org/acsm-registered-clinical-exercise-physiologist
You must have completed an undergraduate degree in exercise and wellness, exercise science, kinesiology, nursing, or a related field in order to be considered for admission. In addition, priority will be given to those who have completed the following prerequisite courses (which must be taken prior to or during the application process):
Undergraduate Course Requirements: --Human Anatomy & Physiology --Physiological Foundations of Movement (Exercise Physiology) --Human Nutrition --Functional Anatomy/Kinesiology --Introduction to Psychology --Statistics --Exercise Testing --Exercise Prescription
Again, thank you for your interest in the Master of Science in Clinical Exercise Physiology program (MS CEP) at Arizona State University. Please contact me if you have any questions.
Thank you,
Kristen Stone, MEd Program Coordinator Sr., Graduate Exercise and Wellness Arizona State University, School of Nutrition and Health Promotion 550 North 3rd Street Phoenix, Arizona 85004 Kristen.J.Stone@asu.edu Phone: 602-496-0862
